text.section: Any person who violates KRS 319.005 shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction, shall be punished by imprisonment for not more than six (6) months, or by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars ($500), or by both fine and imprisonment, and each violation shall be deemed a separate offense.
Either the Attorney General or the appropriate Commonwealth's or county attorney shall have the authority to prosecute violations of KRS 319.005.
The board may recover the costs of investigative expenses including reasonable attorney fees relating to the prosecution of those found guilty of violating KRS 319.005.

law.history: Amended 2001 Ky. Acts ch. 80, sec. 15, effective June 21, 2001. -- Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 104, sec. 11, effective July 14, 1992. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 128, sec. 17, effective July 15, 1986. -- Amended 1964 Ky. Acts ch. 154, sec. 17. -- Created 1948 Ky. Acts ch. 169, sec. 13.
